intro: Dysophylla linearis, commonly known as the linear leaf dysophylla, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, linear leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of the Araliaceae family. Dysophylla linearis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
